name: places/ChIJi7FB1VxZwokRT_rIuwwmyEg
formattedAddress: 20 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text:
My go to breakfast delivery. Everything is delicious and they deliver fast even when I get an early start at 4am.

If they would only add fried egg and avocado options to their grilled cheese sandwich on seamless, they would be the best deli in NYC.

text.text:

originalText.text: Chefs behind the grill stole $4 from me. Ordered 2 Omelets one morning and went to checkout at the counter. Omelet with Cheese should have been $7 each, but the deli chefs yell over to the counter person that it was $8.95 each. I go to the deli chefs and point at the menu and show them that it should be $7. They say no menu doesn't matter we are charging you $8.95 and are laughing at me and making fun of me in Spanish which I can speak. One of the worst dining experiences I have ever received. When I go at night time the deli chefs are always kind and only charge $7 for an omelet. Whoever owns this deli should speak with the deli chefs that work the day shift.

originalText.text:
I absolutely have to give a shoutout to the deli on my corner in NYC. This place has become a true lifesaver for my roommates and me. Not only are the staff incredibly friendly and welcoming, but the fact that they're open 24/7 is an absolute game-changer.

Now, let's talk about the food. Their sandwiches are the stuff of legends, and I have to give a special shoutout to the Derek Jeter sandwich – it's like a home run for my taste buds every time. The combinations they put together are pure genius, and you can tell they put thought and care into every bite.

What really seals the deal for me is their selection. I've never been to a deli that has such an impressive array of food and drinks. Whether I'm looking for a quick snack, a refreshing drink, or even something more substantial, they always have exactly what I need.

My roommates and I have practically become regulars here, grabbing a meal at least three times a week. And you know what? They've never once let us down. Each visit feels like coming home to a delicious meal that never fails to hit the spot.

So, if you're in the neighborhood and you haven't checked out this deli yet, you're seriously missing out. Friendly staff, 24/7 convenience, mouthwatering sandwiches (especially that Derek Jeter masterpiece), and an incredible variety of food and drinks – what more could you ask for? This place has truly become a staple in our lives, and I can't recommend it enough.

originalText.text: I was craving a particular sandwich that Fancy NY Grill and Deli didn’t have on their menu but they made a special order of exactly what I wanted! Might be in my top 3 favorite sandwiches ever. Super nice, accommodating, fast delivery, and really great prices! A+++

text.text: I was craving a particular sandwich that Fancy NY Grill and Deli didn’t have on their menu but they made a special order of exactly what I wanted! Might be in my top 3 favorite sandwiches ever. Super nice, accommodating, fast delivery, and really great prices! A+++

originalText.text: I’ve ordered from this deli multiple times on DoorDash and seamless. So I’ve spent at least $100 @ this location. Never a problem. Today, I called to place a direct order. As I needed to use cash. I was hung-up on multiple times. The last time @12:30pm, I called to ask if there’s a better time I should call back because maybe they were busy. The woman told me “it’s still busy” & before I could follow-up, hung up on me. Extremely unprofessional and rude. Especially given I have been customer multiple times in the past. For this; I don’t think I’ll order from them again. As no paying customers should be treated in such poor manner. I understand things get busy but it only takes 3 seconds to suggest a better time to call back.
